In this lesson, we will expand your skills in asking for directions in Japanese. We will introduce phrases like "Can you show me on the map", "I'm lost", and "I'm looking for".
Let's start with the phrase "Can you show me on the map"? In Japanese, you would say:

lang.mstts:prosody: 地図で示していただけますか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Let's practice that. "Can you show me on the map" is:

lang.mstts:prosody: 地図で示していただけますか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Now, let's learn how to express "I'm lost". In Japanese, you say:

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は道に迷っています
私は道に迷っています

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Lastly, we have "I'm looking for". In Japanese, it is:

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Here's how you can incorporate these phrases into a conversation. When you are looking for a museum, you could say:

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は博物館を探しています。地図で示していただけますか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
, which translates to "I'm looking for the museum. Can you show me on the map?".
Then, if you can't find the way and feel lost, you could say

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は道に迷っています。博物館はどこですか

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
, which translates to "I'm lost. Where is the museum?".
Great work on this lesson! You can now ask for help in finding your way by stating "Can you show me on the map" as

lang.mstts:prosody: 地図で示していただけますか
私は道に迷っています

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . Keep practicing these phrases, and you'll navigate Japan with confidence!
